forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Hi all  
> i would like to create a bootable USB external drive that contain multiple iso's that i can peak from a menu and load.  
> for instance an iso of windows 7 to load and install on the computer hard drive or iso that contain linux machine  
>
> i succeed to install grub4dos and load the windows 7 iso but i'm not able to continue with the installation, fail on the selecting of the source drive  
>
> any suggestion please.

It's not as easy as you may think. :wink:   

Each .iso and OS has it's own "story" to tell. :wink:   

Here is a thread where only working .iso's with grub4dos are listed:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=5041](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=5041 "External link")  

I presume that since PE 2.x (read Vista based) .iso's do work, it is very probable that PE 3.x (read Windows7 based) .iso's ***may*** work, but I don't recall having seen a specific report of such an attempt.  

This method/app:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...howtopic=120444](http://www.msfn.org/board/index.php?showtopic=120444 "External link")  
can setup a Windows7 booting from USB, as well as the other apps/methods in the "Install XP from USB" thread on MSFN.  
A bunch of related links is assembled on this thread:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...howtopic=135899](http://www.msfn.org/board/index.php?showtopic=135899 "External link")  

Browse/search the grub4dos Forum:  
[http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=66](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=66 "External link")  
to possibly find workarounds for things that cannot be booted through .iso mapping.
